Save almost $300 on this AMD Ryzen 5 7600X combo bundle that includes mobo, 
AIO, SSD, and PSU

Prices subject to change. Read More Last Updated on March 12, 2024 Newegg’s gaming PC deals are currently offering discounted prices on all-star components as part of a new flash sale which sees the AMD Ryzen 5 7600X CPU with a heavy discount with further savings with a Gigabyte B650 Aorus Elite motherboard, DDR5 RAM, Samsung 990 Pro 2TB SSD, and ASUS ROG Strix 850W PSU. Let’s get into the details. It starts with the Gigabyte B650 Aorus Elite AX V2 which is available for just $199.99 (was $230) for a $30 saving. This is then compounded with the AMD Ryzen 5 7600X for only $229 (was $299) for $70 off. Then you factor in Crucial Pro Overclocking 32GB DDR5 RAM for a mere $92.99 (was $160) for $67 off with the ASUS ROG Strix 850W being $10 off. That’s an initial saving of $177 before factoring in the further combo deals which add up to a staggering $267 off taken as a whole. That’s because there’s an extra $10 off the Crucial Pro Overclocking DDR5 RAM, $20 off the Samsung 990 Pro 2TB, $10 off the ASUS ROG Strix 850W, and $10 off the Corsair iCUE Link H150i RGB AIO. All together you’re looking at a total combo up saving of $90 for a total of $1,031.45 when taking the entire build on as a whole. Check out the full bundle for total combo savings. AMD Ryzen 5 7600X Best Deals Corsair iCUE Link H150i RGB Best Deals ASUS ROG Strix 850W Best Deals Samsung 990 Pro 2TB Best Deals Crucial Pro Overclocking 32GB DDR5 6000 MHz Best Deals Gigabyte B650 Aorus Elite AX V2 Best Deals The components here may not be quite the cheapest that you can get for a rig but they are current-generation and high quality meaning you’re investing in solid parts for less. Speaking to the motherboard, which includes a Gen 5 SSD port as well as two Gen 4 SSD ports for fast storage as well as a solid rear I/O packed with USB 3 ports, USB-C ports, and fast ethernet, all for under the $200 mark. Then we get onto the Samsung 990 Pro which is among the best SSDs for gaming, especially with its discounted price tag. It caps out at the end of what Gen 4 NVMe SSDs can do with performance pushing above 7,000MB/s read and write respectively. Once you install your OS on it, you’ll enjoy lightning-fast boot times, with enough storage for many high-end PC games. While there’s no GPU included in this bundle, you’ll be well-equipped to slot one with all this gear setting you up for success all over just over the $1,000 mark. There’s a leading AMD motherboard, solid mainstream chipset, fast RAM, excellent AIO, and powerful 850W so you shouldn’t have to worry about future upgrades any time soon.
